intro: Anthocleista schweinfurthii, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along riverbanks. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been used in traditional African medicine for various ailments.
